alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:32AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Blount, Etowah and Cherokee Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 731 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Summerville to near Tabor Road to Susan Moore. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Steele, Leesburg, Altoona, Snead, Susan Moore, Walnut Grove, Reece City, Sand Rock, Gaylesville and Cherokee Rock Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
